page.title: 19Landscape and Ecology
page.content: LANDSCAPE.The area is intensively farmed and hedged fields reach almost to the highest land (400m) with much of the land used for grazing.Buildings are attractive and old apart from the modern crude barns that have appeared. The hills in the south have conifer plantations on the lower flanks but not to any great degree. ECOLOGY.There has been little tendency to remove hedges and enlarge fields with the result that habitats are not destroyed. The upper hills are largely natural and unspoilt though the tendency in recent times to make roads onto the highest hills is making the continued wildness less certain. Wildlife is plentiful - buzzard, rabbit. fox, owls, partridge are all common and the river is clean and not polluted.
